messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:49): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6, various people think something is wrong with CORS, but I guess you could say we have just not bothered so far
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (09:49): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, please bother :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:49): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6, it's on the roadmap and I plan to continue fixing the spec :)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (09:50): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, what *is* wrong with CORS?

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:51): well, some security researchers believe that the web security model ( http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-abarth-principles-of-origin ) is wrong and that by entrenching it further with CORS we are making things worse
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:51): specifically, that people will design solutions with CORS that will open them up to become "confused deputies"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:51): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yt?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (09:53): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, i am confused. this is duck. QUACK
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:54): i don't understand http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=11893
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:54): why is the html spec the place to define how aria works in svg?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:55): or if that's not the proposal, why would we want multiple definitions of how to implement aria?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:55): oh hey, Doug Schepers objects to publishing DOM Core too now
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (09:55): &lt 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6> &lt edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e> Pretty good email filters then <- *cough*
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (09:56): (he's who I was surprised at not saying anything the other day...)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:58): oh, and he's also rewriting history claiming I'm the one who's doing it
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (09:58): his mail seemed not-so-subtly political, so, uh, have fun I guess
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:58): I wonder if that discussion was minuted
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (10:05): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: your css doesn't make it easy to see what is a quote and what is a prose. Maybe a border-left would help
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (10:05): re: your last blog post
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:08): hmm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:09): you have a point, but I don't really feel like addressing it now
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:09): so I found the minutes and Doug Schepers is wrong
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:09): I wonder why he didn't check them himself
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:10): if you want to make broad claims like someone attempting to rewrite history you ought to check your facts
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:20): hey edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:20): dom core doesn't define that children are ordered
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:21): (so e.g. the definition of "preceding sibling" is unclear)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:21): that doesn't follow from finite hierarchical tree?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:22): no
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:22): you can have unordered trees
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:22): (e.g. nested hash tables)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:23): best to just explicitly say that an object has an ordered list of children
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:23): and define things in terms of that, imho
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:23): so " finite hierarchical tree structures" -> " finite hierarchical ordered tree structures"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:23): i still think it'd be better to be explicit in the definition

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:24): or "An object A is a child of an object B if and only if B is the parent of A." -> "An object A is a child of an object B if and only if B is the parent of A. The children of an object are ordered."
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:24): that makes it a statement of fact; not entirely correct hmm

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:24): i think you're better off introducing an explicit child list, something like "an object in a tree has a parent and a child list" and then define everything in terms of that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:25): and have that instead of "has a number of properties that other objects do not" which is a bit weak
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:25): hmm yeah, that could work
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:25): thanks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:26): np
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:26): i'll probably hook into this for webvtt
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:39): right, bed time
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:39): nn
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:44): https://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/dom-core/changeset/d57a85905b1c

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (10:50): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: "A is called a sibling of an object B, if and only if B and A share the same parent." should that say eg. "the same non-null parent"?

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:52): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I obviously did not get the Notifications draft pub-ready yesterday, but I am now getting it set up for publication on Tuesday
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:53): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, cool, I'll update the WG
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:54): thnks
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (10:56): should it also specifically prohibit cycles?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (10:56): (implicit from calling it a tree, but most of that section is)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (10:57): well, I guess the point of that section is defining the terms, which the cycle restriction isn't relevant to
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:58): it might be fun to define tree from first principles and that is what I wanted to do initially, but I gave up on that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:58): I would need to learn a bit more for that I think :)
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (11:00): hmm Norway has a strange effect on my sleepiness level. Lack of light?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:01): you should go there in summer
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:01): it's crazy
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:01): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6, required an actual parent now :)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (11:01): those poor lonely root nodes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:02): I have not needed "root" so far
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:02): there's a note in the spec about nuking it
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (11:03): seems rare enough that just saying "if parent is null" when needed is good enough
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:04): I'll wait for hixie to redo HTML and see what comes out of that before getting rid of it
